title: Monocular Depth Estimation and Segmentation for Transparent Object with Iterative Semantic and Geometric Fusion
author: Jiangyuan Liu (School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Hongxuan Ma (School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Yuxin Guo (School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Yuhao Zhao (School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Chi Zhang (School of Information Science and Technology, Shijiazhuang Tiedao University), Wei Sui (Institute of Automation of Chinese Academy of Sciences), Wei Zou (School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences†)
relevance_why: The concepts of depth estimation and segmentation can be applicable in audio signal processing, particularly in the segmentation of audio events where transparent or overlapping sounds may require similar strategies.
background: The paper focuses on developing a framework that simultaneously estimates the depth and segments transparent objects in images captured using a single RGB camera, which is challenging due to the properties of transparent materials.
contribution: This paper introduces an innovative monocular framework that excels in both depth estimation and segmentation of transparent objects, achieving superior performance compared to existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often require multiple input modalities or complex multi-view setups, which limit their accessibility and efficiency.
technical_comparison.novelty: This study implements an iterative refinement strategy alongside a semantic and geometric fusion module, which jointly enhances both depth and segmentation prediction.

key_innovation: The unique iterative fusion process refines predictions progressively by exploiting interactions between semantic information and geometric depth features.
real_world_impact: The methods developed could enhance robotic manipulation tasks involving transparent objects, which could be beneficial in various applications such as automated sorting in warehouses or manipulation in surgical robots.
limitations: No specific limitations were explicitly mentioned by the author.

new_terms.semantic and geometric fusion: **Semantic and geometric fusion** refers to the integration of semantic information (such as object categories) with geometric information (such as spatial location) to enhance predictive performance in tasks like depth estimation and segmentation.

open_sourcing: Codes and models are publicly available at https://github.com/L-J-Yuan/MODEST.
